Metal dichalcogenide alloy embedded PANI/ZIF-8 composite electrocatalysts for sustainable hydrogen evolution reactions AkhilaÂ Muhammed, AswathyÂ RetnakaranÂ Sugandhi, SumiÂ VijayakumariÂ SasidharanÂ Nair, ThusharaÂ Remadevi, AntonyÂ Bruz and RijithÂ Sreenivasan 115402 Efficient nanosheet clusters Ni6Fe2Co2/NF-VC for promoting the OER in anion exchange membrane electrolysis ZandongÂ Zhang, JingÂ Xin, ZuoboÂ Yang, WeixuanÂ Liu, HongchenÂ Liu, JimmyÂ Yun and JieÂ Zhang This study developed a ternary Ni6Fe2Co2/NF-VC nanoparticle cluster material, aiming to enhance the efficiency of oxygen evolution reaction (OER) and achieve excellent water decomposition performance. A self-supported anode was fabricated via one-electrode reduction synthesis for the OER active site, which exhibits significant catalytic activity due to its unique surface restructuring process and controlled electronic structure. The results demonstrate that this anode has outstanding intrinsic catalytic activity in asymmetric electron mediator (AEM) electrolysis: at 10 mA/cmÂ² current density, the overpotential is as low as 203 mV, with a Tafel slope of 19.69 mV/dec. Under industrial testing conditions (500 mA/ cmÂ²), the anode requires only 1.98 V to operate stably and maintains stable operation for 50 hours under continuous cycling. 115412 Mesoporous CuOx/VOx derived from amorphous MOFs as a highly selective catalyst for aerobic oxidation of alcohols to aldehydes ZhigangÂ Zhang, ShuaiÂ Wang, WenwenÂ Li, YuntaoÂ Hu, BinÂ Wang, GengxiuÂ Zheng and HuaiqingÂ Zhao Mesoporous CuOx/VOx derived from amorphous MOFs as a heterogenous catalyst enables the selective oxidation of alcohols to aldehydes with additive-free using oxygen as the sole oxidant under mild conditions.
